section.name: How run a design with Teolenn

ul.li: A computer that can execute Teolenn (see installation requirements for more informations).

The sequence of the genome you want use for the design.
This genome must be in one file at Fasta format.
The header of each chromosome must be simple (short as possible, without punctuation marks or other symbols).
>chromosome_1 TATATAAAAACCTTTACTACTTTTACTATTATTATTACCTTATTATATAGTTATAATTAACTTCCTTTTA GCACTACTATTAATAAATAATAAATATAATATACTACTAATTACTATAAATAAATTTAGTAAAAAGGTAA TTCTAAAACTAGTTAAAAAAACTAATATAGCCTTAAAAATAGCTAATAAGCTAGTAGCAAGACTTTTAAA ...

The sequence of the masked genome if you want use the complexity measurement.
This genome must be in one file at Fasta format.
The header of each chromosome must be simple (short as possible, without punctuation marks or other symbols).
The name of the header of each chromosome must be the same for genome file and genome masked file.

subsection.name: Non standard Installation
subsection.p: Soap and genometools can be installed manualy. This is mandatory if the executable is not built-in in Teolenn.

tr.td: This the i386 that is embedded because it was impossible to compile genometools as a static executable for this architecture. IA32 compatibility libraries are may be needed.

subsection.name: The design file
subsection.p: The design file is core element of a design using Teolenn. It contains the filters to apply on generated sequences, the measurements to compute, the filters on measurements and the selection parameters. The design file is an XML file (see Wikipedia article for more information about XML). This file allow Teolenn to be very flexible design tool. As the deisgn file is the central part of Teolenn you must read carefuly the design file section of the documentation.
You can also use the Trichoderma reesei design file as a model your design. Don't forget in this design that the parameters are specific to Trichoderma reesei and need to be adapted to your design.

subsection.name: The Teolenn process
subsection.p: There are 5 steps in the Teolenn process to select the best oligonucleotides:

ol.li: Generate all oligonucleotides sequences for the genome and the genome masked (create one file per chromosome, the extension of this files are ".oligo" and ".masked" files).
Filter oligonucleotides sequences (one file per chromosome, the extension of this files are ".oligo.filtered" and ".masked.filtered" files)
Filter measurements (create the filtered.mes and the filtered.stat file)

Compute the selection of the oligonucleotides (create the select.mes file). This final step
For each measurement and oligonucleotide compute a score using the measurement value and sometimes one or more statistical parameters (defined in the parameters values of the measurements in the select section of the design file). A score is a float value between 0 and 1 whereas a measurement value can have any type and value (negative, string...).
Apply a weight on each measurement score to get a global score for an oligonucleotide.
Choose the oligonucleotide with the best score a window.

subsection.p: As there is the need of statistical data for the last step of the process, Teolenn must be launched two times. One to get the statistical data and one to get the selected oligonucleotides. You can skip the 4 firsts steps in the second run using the skip attribute in the design file (see the design file section of the documentation more informations).
